source.ocean_spectra

Module Contents

Functions

pierson_moskowitz_spectrum

Compute Pierson-Moskowitz spectrum S(omega)

WvHeight

Compute wave height based on frequency sampling and summation (basically inverse fourier transform)

API

source.ocean_spectra.pierson_moskowitz_spectrum(omega: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], Hs: float, Tp: float) → numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64][source]

Compute Pierson-Moskowitz spectrum S(omega)

The formula adopted from Ocen Wave Specctra by WikiWaves.

Input

  1. omega: Frequency sampling, (float N_omega) (rad/s)

  2. Hs: Significan wave height, (m)

  3. Tp: Peak wave period, (s)

Returns

spectrum: (float N_omega)

source.ocean_spectra.WvHeight(omega: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], spectrum: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], evalTime: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], phase_rand: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64]) → numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.complex128][source]

Compute wave height based on frequency sampling and summation (basically inverse fourier transform)

The wave height calculated based on Tabesphour (2023).

Inputs

  1. omega: frequency sampling, (float N_omega) (rad/s)

  2. spectrum: spectrum to be used, (float N_omega) (m\(^2\)/s)

  3. evalTime: times at which the wave height is evaluated, (float N_evalTime) (s)

  4. phase_rand: random phases to get ocean spectra corresponding to each of omega, (float N_omega) (rad/s)

Returns

WvHeightResult: array(len(evalTime))
